Description: Red pottery shabti jar with a small flat base, vertical sides carinated near the base and at the shoulder, and a flared neck. Band of floral decoration painted around base of neck and hieroglyphic inscription written vertically down the side. Separate lid of dark coloured pottery in the form of the head of a jackal, with yellow painted details.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1996 11 Jul-6 Oct, Japan, Arita, Kyushu Ceramic Museum, Ceramics and Civilisation
